titleStmt.title: Iames by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. To all to whom these presents shall come, greeting. Whereas we haue beene informed, aswell by a lamentable petition on the behalfe of fifteene hundred of our louing subiects, English men, remaining in miserable seruitude and subiection in Argier, Tunis, Sally, Tituane ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)

titleStmt.title: Iames by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. To all to whom these presents shall come, greeting. Whereas we haue beene informed, aswell by a lamentable petition on the behalfe of fifteene hundred of our louing subiects, English men, remaining in miserable seruitude and subiection in Argier, Tunis, Sally, Tituane ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords. Proceedings. 1624-05-27.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Bonham Norton and John Bill,

notesStmt.note: Includes the text of the captives' petition and an order from the House of Lords of 27 May 1624 for a collection for the captives.
Dated at end: Westminster the nine and twentieth day of Iune, in the two and twentieth yeere of our reigne ..
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
